title: How to Unlock the National Pokédex in Pokémon Platinum

steps.title: Play through the main story until you become the Pokémon Champion.
steps.content: Play through the main story until you become the Pokémon Champion. Unlocking the National Dex is a postgame feature—in other words, you have to defeat the Elite 4 as well as the Pokémon Champion before you can get it. Beat the Pokémon to progress to the postgame. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Physically see all of the Pokémon in the Sinnoh Pokédex.
steps.content: Physically see all of the Pokémon in the Sinnoh Pokédex. While you’re not required to physically catch all 210 Pokémon in the regional Sinnoh Pokédex, you are required to run into them all at one point or another. Most of these Dex entries can be gained by battling all the trainers you encounter, though it’s important to note that some Pokémon in the game aren’t actually owned by any trainers. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Visit Professor Rowan in Sandgem Town to receive the National Dex.
steps.content: Visit Professor Rowan in Sandgem Town to receive the National Dex. Show your completed Sinnoh Pokédex to Rowan, who confirms if it’s filled out. At that point, Professor Oak visits and upgrades your device to the National Dex. [3] X Research source Oak also hands over a Poké Radar, which makes it easier to find non-Sinnoh Pokémon in grassy patches of the wild.

steps.title: Rotom
steps.content: Rotom During the in-game night, head to the Old Chateau that sits close to the exit point of Eterna Forest. As you’re exploring the Old Chateau, walk around the second floor until you run into a wild Rotom. [4] X Research source The Old Chateau requires Cut (HM01) to reach. Note: If you ran into this Pokémon before becoming Pokémon Champion, it should spawn again in the Old Chateau once you’ve entered the Hall of Fame. [5] X Research source Beyond this, however, you will only get one chance to catch Rotom so make sure you do not knock it out. Save before battling it.

steps.title: Unown
steps.content: Unown Head to the very bottom floor of the Solaceon Ruins and start walking around. Once you’ve successfully reached the lowest floor, wild Unown Pokémon will spawn. [6] X Research source Even if you explored part of the Ruins before, you wouldn’t have encountered any Unowns without hitting the bottom floor first.

steps.title: Manaphy
steps.content: Manaphy Head to Route 212 and enter Mr. Backlot’s mansion, heading directly to his office. On the desk, inspect the book that’s there—a picture of Manaphy is printed, which registers the Legendary as “seen” in your Pokédex. [7] X Research source Pokémon Platinum held an event back in the late 2000s that allowed players to catch this Pokémon; however, this event is no longer available. Inspecting the book is your best bet in filling out your Sinnoh Pokédex.

steps.title: The Lake Trio (Mesprit, Azelf, and Uxie}
steps.content: The Lake Trio (Mesprit, Azelf, and Uxie} During the game’s main storyline, you went up against Giratina in the Distortion World. After this point, the Legendary Lake Trio (Mesprit, Azelf, and Uxie) were all available to be found in their respective cave areas on specific lakes: [8] X Research source Lake Verity: Mesprit Lake Valor: Azelf Lake Acuity: Uxie Warning: All of these Pokémon can be battled and caught , but Mesprit in particular will teleport around your game before you can catch it. Don’t worry, though—as long as you interact with it in the cave (before it leaves), it’ll still be registered in your Pokédex.
